content.raw:
Hi,

I was testing the parser tutorial and for >>> parser.is_modX('pTx')  I am getting True in python 3.7 when your tutorial says False.  Should your tutorial say True?  It is matching against re.compile(r'([^A-Z-]*)([A-Z])') and looking at the explanation page [here](http://rick.measham.id.au/paste/explain.pl?regex=r%27%28%5B%5EA-Z-%5D*%29%28%5BA-Z%5D%29%27) it says:
 [^A-Z-]*               any character except: 'A' to 'Z', '-' (0
                             or more times (matching the most amount
                             possible))

so if I basically type in anything but all lower case letters for the second [A-Z] I will get True because numbers matches the any character besides 'A' to 'Z', '-' 0 or more times


```
'brianisnumbeR1' returns True (don't think this is a mod)
'RTTTSaaa444' returns True (same not a mod)
'abcd' returns False as it should
'aa' returns False as it should
```


Should this line from pyteomics.parser file be changed? line 208 for me.
```
_modX_split = re.compile(r'([^A-Z-]*)([A-Z])')
```
content.html:
Hi,

I was testing the parser tutorial and for >>> parser.is_modX('pTx') I am getting True in python 3.7 when your tutorial says False. Should your tutorial say True? It is matching against re.compile(r'([^A-Z-])([A-Z])') and looking at the explanation page here it says: [^A-Z-] any character except: 'A' to 'Z', '-' (0 or more times (matching the most amount possible))

so if I basically type in anything but all lower case letters for the second [A-Z] I will get True because numbers matches the any character besides 'A' to 'Z', '-' 0 or more times

'brianisnumbeR1' returns True (don't think this is a mod)
'RTTTSaaa444' returns True (same not a mod)
'abcd' returns False as it should
'aa' returns False as it should

Should this line from pyteomics.parser file be changed? line 208 for me.

_modX_split = re.compile(r'([^A-Z-]*)([A-Z])')
